thinking.disposable_income: Midtown residents have relatively high disposable incomes with a median household income around $87,000, significantly above Houston's average.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: As a young professional-dominated area with many dining, entertainment, and retail options, Midtown residents tend to have high discretionary spending on lifestyle amenities.
thinking.accessibility: Midtown has excellent multi-modal transportation access with MetroRail, frequent bus service, walkable streets, and good road connectivity to downtown and other major employment centers.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Given high incomes, residents can absorb moderate fees/taxes while valuing time savings. 2. Strong existing transit infrastructure means improvements will be well-utilized. 3. Dense, mixed-use character makes transit and walking viable options. 4. Young professional demographic likely to embrace multi-modal options if convenient. 5. Selected policies that balance moderate taxes/fees with significant transit improvements and driving time reductions. 6. Prioritized options with lower transit fares to encourage ridership given good existing service. 7. Accepted some driving fees to fund improvements and reduce congestion.
